div.h1: Family Resources: How to explain the Coronavirus-19 to children
div.p: by Sheila Adams | Mar 31, 2020 | coronavirus, Homepage Featured, Lufkin ISD | 0 comments

p.span: Explaining the Coronavirus-19 to children can be challenging. Please use these resources to help you explain this complicated concept to children.

a.span: Julia Cook reads The Yucky Bug (K-2 grade)

span.a: Just for Kids: Comic Exploring the New Coronavirus from NPR

li.a: How to Talk to Your Kid about Coronavirus

a.span: A Story to Help Children Understand Coronavirus

li.span: from Music City Counselor
from Counselor Keri

a.span: PBS How to Talk to your Kid about Coronavirus
Talking to Your Child About COVID-19: A Parent Resource

p.span: Many counselors around the country have been sharing resources for families to help with Social-Emotional Learning. The resources below are options to help. Please click on them as fun activities to help during this challenging time.

li.span: – Counseling with Ms. Ramirez
– Counseling with Ms. Ramirez

a.span: Howard B. Wigglebottom Books, Animated Books, Songs, Posters, and Lessons
Giant List of Ideas for Being Home with Your Kids
Supporting your Children’s Social, Emotional, and Mental Health During the COVID-19 Pandemic
10 Days of Live ‘Choose Love’ Lessons For Parents and Children

li.span: – from Bright Futures Counseling
– Free Download on Teachers Pay Teachers from Mindful Counselor Molly

a.span: Yoga, Mindfulness and Relaxation Designed for Kids Aged 3+
Videos for Sleep, Meditation, and Relaxation

li.span: – Free til April 1

a.span: Feeling Anxious or Worried? Listen to These 8 Podcasts
Love in a Time of Corona:A Homebound Self-Care Guide for Parents and Students

li.span: – from School Counselor Stephanie

a.span: Ultimate Guide to Mental Health and Education Resources for Kids and Teens
Taking Care of Your Mental Health in the Face of Uncertainty
5 Ways to Help Teens Manage Anxiety about the Coronavirus

li.span: – From Amy on Instagram (allthings_lovelyxo)

a.span: Ideas for Activities During School Closings
Stuck at Home? These 12 Famous Museums Offer Virtual Tours You Can Take on Your Couch

li.span: (Video)
(Educational Videos)
(for kids 12 and under) (there is a cost – $7.99/month)
– Streams videos featuring celebrated actors reading children’s books alongside creatively produced illustrations

a.span: Best Music Apps and Games for Kids
50 Books All Kids Should Read Before They’re 12
Common Sense Selections highlighting the best movies and TV shows
Best Documentaries for Kids and Families
Common Sense Media (reviews for what your kids want to watch before they watch it)

li.span: Write notes, letters, draw pictures to send or drop off at local nursing homes – the elderly in nursing homes aren’t allowed to have visitors right now and it will brighten their day!

– Coding is the new literacy! With ScratchJr, young children (ages 5-7) can program their own interactive stories and games. In the process, they learn to solve problems, design projects, and express themselves creatively on the computer
– Learn computer science
– Programming for kids

– Hello Ruby is the world’s most whimsical way to learn about computers, technology and programming. The story started with a book, and now Ruby continues her adventures in exercises, activities and videos. It’s suited for kids age 5 years and older (but even adults might learn something new)
Public libraries – many public libraries have digital books you can rent for free on their websites, along with other resources
YouTube channel

a.span: 450 Ivy League courses you can take online right now for free
Met to launch “Nightly Met Opera Streams”

li.span: – A free series of encore Live in HD presentations streamed on the company website during the coronavirus closure
– We teach children ages 4-11 how to figure out WHAT they are feeling, WHY they are having that emotion, and HOW to make better choices
– Sorted by categories
– Over 30 virtual field trips with links
– free online audiobooks

a.span: Cincinnati Zoo is Bringing the Zoo to You!
100 things to do while stuck inside due to a pandemic
11 Amazing Places Around New York That You Can Virtually Travel To Without Ever Leaving Your Home
Discover 10 Parks & Preserves in Albany County

li.span: – Are you social distancing but want to get out of the house? If you are healthy, explore one of the parks or preserves in Albany County! Governor Cuomo announced that NYS will waive all park fees as of March 16, 2020

a.span: Calendar/list of live streams to watch

li.span: – a Chrome extension for watching Netflix remotely with friends

a.span: 15 Broadway Plays and Musicals You Can Watch On Stage From Home

li.span: has made their entire media library – images, sounds, and video – public

– formerly stumbleupon, Mix is a social content curation site that allows you to collect articles, and content about specific interests or topics that you like. When you curate and add to your collections, your content is shared with friends and made discoverable to others on Mix who share similar interests.
Use
to learn a new language or practice one you already know!

a.span: You Can Now Tour 2,500 World-Famous Museums From the Comfort of Your Own Sofa

li.span: will be producing daily Broadway Virtual Concerts featuring stars of the stage and screen, singing and performing live (from home)! Tune in each day at 2pm and 8pm
Getting outdoors and connecting with nature is a way to help maintain our physical and mental health (as long as you are maintaining social distancing!). Find a location near you at the
has a website just for kids with videos, activities, and games!

a.span: Explore the surface of Mars on the Curiosity Rover

li.span: The Canadian site
offers 11 Virtual Tours of farms from minks, pigs, and cows, to apples and eggs
